text: Hey team, wanted to let you all know I may have found a solution to the skippyness of the floating photos. I just doubled the frame rate, and now it's smooth as butter on the Planar! Of course that doubles the file size... with my current render settings, it's jumped from 700MB to 1.4GB... :( <@U026PT0D7>, do you think that's going to be too big for this?
I don't know. there's one way to find out...
Yeah?
This is also best possible export settings... I could strip some things down, I'm sure.
I can whip up a simple video player thing to test it out if you send me the video file (mp4 preferred)
Ok, I'm currently exporting in .MOV format, I'll export an .MP4 and get back to you. (it might end up being smaller anyway.
great, thanks!
good to hear on all fronts here

Well, it's gonna take about a half-hour to render this new MP4 version... but the estimated file size already looks much much smaller. 55MB was the projected size. We will see how the end result actually measures up.
55MB from 1.4GB?!
yeah, well, that's MP4 vs MOV, I think the MOV file is relatively uncompressed (still learning the shit-ton of knowledge around video rendering, codecs, etc.)
oh, cool. that's good knowledge to have I bet
It's way over my head but I have a loose grasp of what it all means... the amount to know is actually incredibly vast.
I just wish it was as easy as choosing PNGs over JPGs.
yeah, once you add more dimensions to the data, the file encoding complexity goes up exponentially
Yeah that's for sure
some people get college degrees just in encoding and compression
Whoa! That makes me feel better knowing that I can at least get a video out in one functional piece.

Hey so here's the video, compressed really well and it seems smooth to me...maybe a couple small lags here and there but I think that's more my machine than the actual video. See how this works for you <@U026PT0D7>, <https://www.dropbox.com/s/276z6suxcpsvyul/CurSci_Intro_Test9.mp4?dl=0>
(just tried playing it in browser and that definitely doesn't work, needs to be downloaded first)
